meanings.definition: A person who is partially or totally unable to use one or more limbs.
meanings.sent1: The poor little cripple struggled to walk with his crutches.
meanings.sent2: The charity organization provided support for the cripple to improve his mobility.
meanings.sent3: The children cheered when the cripple won the race using a wheelchair.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure acted as a mental cripple, holding her back from trying new things.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cripple trying to climb the stairs stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To cause severe damage or harm to something, making it unable to function properly.
meanings.sent1: The harsh winter weather can cripple the crops in the fields.
meanings.sent2: The virus can cripple a computer system within minutes.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected power outage could cripple the progress of the project.
meanings.sent4: Lack of communication can cripple a relationship over time.
meanings.sent5: The economic crisis threatened to cripple the small business.
